message:
#Hardware #Compatibility
[Q] Replaced my HP Probook 4540s original battery with 4330s lousy - made in china- one ...
The problem, it doesn't accept charging (plugged in and charging) but no charge percentage increase !

Some numbers u may ask for :
Old battery voltage = this one
Old mAh is 4300 < this one 4400

Contacted the IT seller but is it a myth or a real to let it 8 hours charging -while lap is off- for the first time to work properly ?

I tried googling if u can teach me better keywords :
q=replace+hp+probook+4540s+battery+with+%24
q=%22replace+probook+4540s+battery+with+4330s+battery%22
q=replaced+battery+won%27t+charge
q=replaced+hp+battery+won%27t+charge

**also followed this topic but noting new till now
http://h30434.www3.hp.com/t5/Other-Notebook-PC-Questions/New-battery-won-t-charge/td-p/1550987

data.message: *this picture for the GUI that checks the new battery status*

The battery seems to be faulty, it could be one of numerous issues:
* The case is empty, i.e. the number of cells is less than advertised and the battery controller IC is reporting false capacity.
* Battery cells are damaged.
* Battery IC is faulty.
